definitions: recreational or competitive sport of gliding over snow on skis
examples: Alpine skiing requires mastery of turning techniques at high speeds
Cross-country skiing provides excellent cardiovascular exercise during winter months

definitions: ability to perform tasks well through training, practice, or experience
degree of proficiency or competence in a particular field or activity
examples: Programming skill takes years of practice to develop fully
Her communication skills helped her advance quickly in management
The job requires advanced skill in data analysis techniques
His skill level improved dramatically after intensive training sessions

definitions: flat-bottomed frying pan with sloped sides for cooking food
examples: Cast iron skillets retain heat evenly for perfect searing
She cooked the vegetables in a non-stick skillet

definitions: layer of material that forms on liquid surfaces
act of reading quickly to grasp main points without detail
examples: The skim of cream floated on the coffee surface
Remove the fatty skim from the soup before serving
A quick skim of the report revealed the key findings
Students often skim textbooks instead of reading thoroughly

definitions: slotted spoon or flat tool for removing items from liquids
device for removing debris from water surfaces like pools
seabird with elongated lower beak for feeding while flying
examples: Use a skimmer to remove the dumplings from boiling water
The pasta skimmer made draining the noodles much easier
The pool skimmer needs cleaning to maintain water quality
Automatic skimmers help keep swimming pools free of leaves
Black skimmers glide low over water catching small fish
The skimmer's unique beak adaptation allows feeding in flight

definitions: illegal copying of credit card information during legitimate transactions
process of removing floating material from liquid surfaces
practice of reading text rapidly to extract main ideas
examples: Card skimming devices at ATMs steal customer financial data
Retailers must check for skimming equipment on payment terminals
Skimming the fat from broth improves its clarity significantly
Regular skimming keeps the swimming pool surface clean
Skimming academic papers helps researchers identify relevant sources quickly
Test-taking strategies often include skimming questions before reading passages

definitions: external organ covering the body providing protection and sensation
outer covering or surface layer of fruits, vegetables, or objects
processed hide of an animal used for leather or other materials
examples: Human skin regenerates approximately every twenty-eight days
Sunscreen protects skin from harmful ultraviolet radiation damage
Potato skin contains valuable nutrients and dietary fiber
The phone's protective skin prevented scratches and damage
Traditional drums often use animal skin for the membrane
Leather workers carefully treat skin to create durable products

definitions: practice and products used for maintaining healthy skin appearance and condition
examples: Daily skincare routines should include cleansing and moisturizing steps
The skincare industry develops products targeting specific skin concerns

definitions: member of youth subculture characterized by shaved heads and specific fashion
person with completely or closely shaved head regardless of affiliation
examples: Traditional skinheads originated in 1960s British working-class culture
Not all skinheads subscribe to extremist political ideologies
His skinhead look was purely aesthetic, not political
Many athletes adopt skinhead styles for practical reasons

definitions: person who removes skins from animals for fur or leather
reference to B.F. Skinner or his behavioral psychology theories
examples: The skinner prepared pelts for the fur trading company
Traditional skinners use specialized knives for precise work
Skinner boxes revolutionized experimental psychology research methods
The skinner approach emphasizes reinforcement in learning behavior

definitions: state or quality of being very thin or having little body fat
confidential or inside information about a situation or topic
examples: The skinny of the model raised health concerns
Extreme skinny can indicate underlying medical conditions
Give me the skinny on what happened at yesterday's meeting
The skinny is that major layoffs are coming next month

definitions: light bouncing step or hop in walking or movement
act of deliberately omitting or bypassing something in sequence
large open container for construction waste or materials transport
examples: Children love to skip down the sidewalk on sunny days
The skip in her step showed her cheerful mood
Don't skip breakfast if you want sustained energy levels
The reader decided to skip the lengthy introduction chapter
The construction skip was filled with demolition debris
Order a skip for the home renovation waste removal

definitions: small tropical tuna species important for commercial fishing and canning
examples: Skipjack tuna comprises most of the world's canned tuna
Pacific skipjack populations support major fishing industries worldwide

definitions: person in command of a ship or boat, especially smaller vessels
small butterfly species with rapid, skipping flight patterns
captain or leader of a sports team, particularly in cricket
examples: The yacht's skipper navigated through challenging coastal waters
Every skipper must hold proper maritime certification credentials
Orange skipjack butterflies darted between wildflower blooms
Grass skippers are common in suburban garden habitats

Team members respected their skipper's tactical expertise

definitions: small-scale military engagement between opposing forces, usually unplanned
brief argument or disagreement between individuals or groups
examples: Border skirmishes escalated tensions between the neighboring countries
The skirmish lasted minutes but revealed strategic weaknesses
Their skirmish over budget allocations delayed the project
Political skirmishes dominated the legislative session's early weeks

definitions: garment hanging from waist covering part or all of legs
outer edge or border area surrounding something central
cut of beef from the diaphragm area of cattle
examples: Her pleated skirt swayed gracefully as she walked
School uniform skirts must meet dress code length requirements
Development expanded to the skirt of the metropolitan area

definitions: short humorous theatrical piece or comedic performance, often satirical
examples: Saturday Night Live skits often parody current political events
Students performed skits demonstrating historical events creatively

definitions: bony structure forming the head skeleton protecting the brain
representation or image symbolizing death, danger, or mortality
examples: The human skull contains twenty-two bones fused together

Pirates flew skull and crossbones flags to intimidate enemies
The skull symbol warns of toxic substances on labels

definitions: black and white striped mammal that sprays foul-smelling liquid defensively
particularly potent variety of cannabis with strong odor
complete defeat preventing opponent from scoring any points
examples: The skunk sprayed our dog requiring multiple tomato juice baths

That skunk strain has an unmistakably pungent aroma
Medical dispensaries often stock various skunk cultivars

Nobody wants to get skunked in their home stadium

definitions: visible atmosphere above earth appearing blue during daytime
upper boundary or highest possible limit of something
examples: Clear blue sky stretched endlessly across the desert landscape

Housing prices reached sky levels in major metropolitan areas
The sky is the limit for this talented young athlete

definitions: person who jumps from aircraft and freefalls before deploying a parachute
examples: The experienced skydiver completed over thousand jumps safely

definitions: sport of jumping from aircraft and performing aerial maneuvers before parachuting
examples: Tandem skydiving allows beginners to experience freefall safely
Professional skydiving competitions feature complex formation patterns

definitions: small brown bird known for singing while flying at great heights
act of frolicking or behaving in a carefree, playful manner
examples: The skylark's melodious song filled the morning countryside air

definitions: window installed in roof or ceiling to admit natural daylight from above
examples: The skylight transformed the dark attic into bright living space

definitions: outline of buildings or landscape features visible against the sky
examples: Manhattan's skyline features iconic skyscrapers and architectural landmarks
The mountain skyline created a dramatic backdrop for photographs

definitions: rocket firework that explodes high in the air with colorful effects
sudden dramatic increase in amount, value, or intensity
examples: Skyrockets illuminated the Fourth of July celebration spectacularly

Her career skyrocketed after winning the prestigious award

definitions: very tall multi-story building characteristic of modern urban architecture
examples: The new skyscraper will house offices and luxury apartments
Chicago pioneered skyscraper construction in the late nineteenth century

definitions: relating to Andrew Jackson's presidency or political philosophy from 1829-1837
political principles emphasizing populism and expansion of democracy
examples: Jacksonian democracy expanded voting rights to all white men

His Jacksonian approach appealed to common citizens over elites

definitions: relating to the reign of James I of England from 1603-1625

examples: Jacobean drama featured darker themes than Elizabethan plays

Jacobean furniture displays heavy oak construction and elaborate details

definitions: member of radical political club during the French Revolution
breed of fancy pigeon with feathered hood around its head

definitions: supporter of James II and his descendants' claim to British throne

definitions: ancient Indian religion emphasizing non-violence, truth, and spiritual liberation through ethical living
examples: Jainism teaches ahimsa as the fundamental principle of existence

definitions: capital and largest city of Indonesia located on Java island
examples: Jakarta serves as Indonesia's economic and political center

definitions: island country in the Caribbean Sea known for reggae music and culture

definitions: first permanent English settlement in North America, established in Virginia in 1607

definitions: member of elite Ottoman infantry corps recruited from Christian youth through devshirme system

definitions: first month of the year in the Gregorian calendar, containing thirty-one days
examples: January marks the beginning of the new fiscal year

definitions: member of traditionally agricultural communities found primarily in Pakistan and northern India
examples: Jat communities have historically engaged in farming and military service

definitions: most populous island of Indonesia containing the capital Jakarta

definitions: name for God used in some English translations of the Hebrew Bible
